markers.name: All The Smoke Lounge
markers.captions: Randomly walked into a shop and met the owner... who went to Auburn University!! What are the chances!?

markers.name: Despensar Airport

markers.name: Sacred Monkey Forest
markers.captions: Monkeys are devious little creatures who should never be trusted

markers.name: Changi Airport

markers.name: The Pod
markers.captions: From private villa to being trapped in a cage... I mean pod. Welcome to Singapore!

markers.name: Nanyuan Noodles
markers.captions: Enjoying duck quesadillas and mango smoothies

markers.name: Fisherman's Village
markers.captions: Night market

markers.name: Charina
markers.captions: Cozy

markers.name: Sairee Beach
markers.captions: Longboats waiting along Sairee Beach to take you on a tour around Koh Tao or just across the water to Nang Yuan

markers.name: Cafes
markers.captions: Exploring the cafes and restaurants around Koh Tao. We found that the food overall was not as good and a bit more expensive than in Phuket - not surprising since all food needs to get shipped in!

markers.name: Sai Nuan Beach
markers.captions: Chasing the sunset on the motorbike

markers.name: Koh Nang Yuan
markers.captions: Day trip to Nang Yuan island on our last day, which was much needed after our scuba training turned out more exhausting than expected. The island was deserted - we only saw a handful of other people the entire time! Nang Yuan is not just one island but two islands connected by a strip of sand. At high-tide, the sandbar disappears under the water, but come low tide you're able to walk between two perfect wading beaches!

markers.name: Shark Bay
markers.captions: Scuba School took up most of our time and energy while we were in Koh Tao, but the sea life was so incredible that I [Kevin]  did a little solo trek down to Shark Bay. I got in the water as the sun was starting to set. I didn't expect to see anything we hadn't already seen, but was startled by a massive turtle peacefully crunching on some coral. It was unfazed by my presence and we were eventually joined by another one of his friends.

markers.name: Tanote Bay
markers.captions: Our first experience in the water at Koh Tao! We had no expectations going in but it ended up being the most incredible experiences of the entire trip! As we got in the water, we saw brightly colored Parrot Fish, Sea Cucumbers, coral in all shapes and sizes. The water was warm with barely any current, and we stayed out until sunset

markers.name: Phuket International Airport
markers.captions: All ready for the journey... just two bigs bags (thanks Lily and Cyrus) and a bowl full of Coq au Vin!

markers.name: Sky and Sea Condos
markers.captions: Relaxing at our very first stop of the trip. The AirBnB had great views of the city and a pool perfect for practicing for our scuba swim test! Kevin made friends with all the local strays (cats)

markers.name: The Pad Thai Shop
markers.captions: We were starving after literally two full days of traveling... the moment we arrived, we dropped off our bags and headed straight to the local pad thai shop down the street. The menu was sparse but everything on it was delicious (and cheap!)

markers.name: The Big Bhudda Hike
markers.captions: We were feeling adventurous and spontaneously decided to hike up to the Big Bhudda! Unfortunately, we went up with minimal research and ran into 90+ degree heat, swarms of mosquitos, and got lost in the jungle. After finally making it up, we were turned away for not being culturally sensitive and wearing appropriate attire.

markers.name: The Big Bhudda
markers.captions: Big Bhudda: The Return. We were finally granted entrance after a change of clothes and a ride up the mountain. The Bhudda was much more magnificent in person and we had great views of the city below. On the way down, we encountered some friendly and photogenic monkeys! This was the last positive monkey encounter...

markers.name: Kata Beach
markers.captions: A small but quaint Phuket beach. Loved the low tides and did a little snorkeling as part of our scuba training.

markers.name: Hog's Head
markers.captions: Old Town in Phuket has it all - little cafes, shops, massage parlors. We stumbled into The Hog's Head, a knock-off Harry-Potter themed cafe in Hogsmead - this turned out to be the perfect spot to nurse some tea and get away from the heat as Kevin was beginning to feel the effects of an ill-advised hawker mango smoothie.

markers.name: Old Town Phuket
markers.captions: Loved Old Town area so much that we ended up coming back. Old Town is known for its architecture, which is influenced by both Chinese and Portuguese aesthetic.

markers.name: Sama Onsen
markers.captions: When it's too hot to do anything else... it's time to hit the spa (thanks to Tahaiya for the recommendation!) This was a traditional Japanese-style Onsen, which combines massage with a relaxing soak. We loved it so much that we came twice!

markers.name: Avista Resort
markers.captions: Turns out just because you're a 5-star resort, doesn't mean you have 5-star food...

markers.name: Naka Night Market
markers.captions: Our first night market experience was a hit! The market was bustling with activity - live music, a huge variety of food and drinks, locals and tourists alike. We had the best Thai Coffee, fried whole crab, and savory tarts.

markers.name: Central Festival
markers.captions: One of our big goals of this trip was to find some nice clothing to bring back. Though the night markets were cheap... so was the quality! Central Festival in Phuket is an absolutely massive facility - essentially two separate malls connected by sky bridge. We explored both - one felt more local while the other had more international designers.

markers.name: Laem Hin Seafood
markers.captions: One of the best hidden local spots known for its fresh "sea-to-table" seafood is Laem Hin. The restaurant was a huge venue sprawling across the water with live tanks filled with all sorts of edible sea life. Our favorite dish was the Black Pepper Crab - eating it reminded me of my childhood feasting on crab that Baba pain-stakingly prepared.

markers.name: Chillva Night Market
markers.captions: Compared to the chaos of Naka, Chillva Night Market was true to its name - CHILL. Because this is a permanent market as opposed to a weekend pop-up, the vendors, shops, and hawkers felt much more organized and established. We loved the vibe here!
